intro: Ackama paniculata, commonly known as the African bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces clusters of blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Ackama paniculata thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade.
